div.p: From Hermann von Nördlinger to [Ferdinand Krauss]
RB MSS M3, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

To proof.
Letter written on the reverse of a letter from J. D. Hooker to Nördlinger, Kew, 14 January 1869. [...]
Check German encyclopaedia: Gossen, Gassen, Hossen, Hassen? Not in my German Auto-Atlas, which lists every little village. It was probably a village, today absorbed into suburbia of a larger township.
If I can't find it, send a p/c of MS and copy of transcript to Johannes, it would not be that far from where he lives, and he should be able to find out the correct name.
31/1 1869.

Wollten Sie so freundlich sein gegenwärtiges Briefchen Herrn Hooker's Ihrer nächsten Sendung an Herrn F. v. Müller beizufügen. Derselbe wird daraus ersehen dass der Weg den er mir empfahl um brevi manu in den Besitz neufall Hölzer zu gelangen fehlgeschlagen hat. Ich glaube dem frühern Schreiben bereits beigefügt zu haben dass sich zu Querscheiben
2 drawings are inserted in the text of the MS here, illustrating how he wants his wood samples to be cut from the tree stumps. gesundes Holz besonders von jüngern, doch auch von ältern Stämmen u. hauptsächlich vom Fuss
u. hauptsächlich ... Fuss interline. eignen u. dass Stückchen von 15 Centim. Fasernlänge zu einer grossen Zahl Schnitte ausreichen.
Zu allen Diensten für Herr F. v. Müller wie für Sie stets mit Vergnügen bereit

div.p: Would you be so kind to include the enclosed letter from Mr Hooker with your next transmission to Mr F. von Mueller. He will see from it, that the path he recommended to me to come into possession of freshly cut timbers quickly has failed. I believe I had mentioned already in my earlier letter, that sound wood from younger, but also from older tree trunks, and mainly from the base, is particularly suitable for cross-sections, and that pieces of 15 centimetres fibre length suffice for a great number of sections.
I am always happy to oblige with any services for Mr F. von Mueller as well as for yourself.

div.p:
Commissioner of Forestry Nördlinger.
What exactly was his position in the Forestry Department? The 'Commissioner' is a rough stab at it, he could have been Minister for Forestry for all I know..
